benchmark_details.name: Cleaned Lang8 GED
benchmark_details.overview: This study focuses on enhancing Grammatical Error Detection (GED) using improved transformer-based models fine-tuned on a rigorously cleaned Lang8 dataset.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the performance of grammatical error detection systems for second language learners.

data.source: Lang8 dataset, cleaned through rigorous data processing techniques.
data.annotation: Automatically generated by cleaning through rigorous steps.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated using the fine-tuned models on test datasets.
methodology.interpretation: An F1 score of 0.91 indicates very good performance in GED tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: BERT-base-uncased achieved an F1 score of 0.91 when trained on 180,000 sentences.
methodology.validation: Models were validated per epoch; training and validation accuracy monitored.
